intro: Pedicularis koidzumiana, commonly known as the Koidzumi's lousewort, is a flowering plant native to the alpine regions of Asia. It belongs to the genus Pedicularis, which is part of the Orobanchaceae family, known for its hemiparasitic nature. The plant features showy, tubular flowers that range in color from yellow to orange, often with contrasting red or purple markings. It typically grows in rocky or mountainous habitats, where it thrives in cool, moist environments. Due to its limited distribution and specific ecological requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species in many regions.
